title: Comment moved when adding tuple parentheses
body:
**To reproduce**

1. Take this file:

```python
class MyClass:
    def my_def(self):
        if self.magic == b"BLP1":
            # Only present for BLP1
            self._blp_encoding, = struct.unpack("<i", self.fp.read(4))
            self._blp_subtype, = struct.unpack("<i", self.fp.read(4))
```

2. Run _Black_ on it with no arguments
3. The comment is moved to the wrong place, and extra parenthesis are added, needing three lines instead of one:

```python
class MyClass:
    def my_def(self):
        if self.magic == b"BLP1":
            (self._blp_encoding,) = struct.unpack(  # Only present for BLP1
                "<i", self.fp.read(4)
            )
            (self._blp_subtype,) = struct.unpack("<i", self.fp.read(4))
```


**Expected behavior**

If I now manually move the comment back to where it belongs:

```python
class MyClass:
    def my_def(self):
        if self.magic == b"BLP1":
            # Only present for BLP1
            (self._blp_encoding,) = struct.unpack(
                "<i", self.fp.read(4)
            )
            (self._blp_subtype,) = struct.unpack("<i", self.fp.read(4))
```

And re-run Black, it's tightened back up:

```python
class MyClass:
    def my_def(self):
        if self.magic == b"BLP1":
            # Only present for BLP1
            (self._blp_encoding,) = struct.unpack("<i", self.fp.read(4))
            (self._blp_subtype,) = struct.unpack("<i", self.fp.read(4))
```

It'd be nice to see this on the first run.

Another (less disruptive) example of a moved comment here:

* https://github.com/hugovk/Pillow/commit/c669a63e1118#diff-b49fc26d17e5d3b539a05c7850abe2b0L3259


**Environment**

- Version: master (version 19.3b1.dev123+g4c4a51c)
- OS and Python version: macOS 10.14, Python 3.7.4

**Does this bug also happen on master?**

I've only tested master.
